entry.name: selectmenu
entry.title: Selectmenu Widget
entry.desc: A jQuery UI widget that duplicates and extends the functionality of a native HTML select element, allowing it to be customizable in behavior and appearance far beyond the limitations of a native select.

longdesc.p: Selectmenu Widget will act as a proxy back to the original select element, controlling its state for form submission or serialization.
Selectmenu Widget support both in-place "popup" or drop-down styles. It supports optgroups and custom markup to render specific presentations like multiple lines.
The select or its options can be disabled by adding the disbaled="disabled" attribite to that element.
When the menu is open, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/LEFT - Move focus to the previous item. If on first item, move focus to the last item.
DOWN/RIGHT - Move focus to the next item. If on last item, move focus to the first item.
ENTER - Select the currently focused item and close the select.

longdesc.p: When the menu is closed, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/LEFT - Select the previous item. If on first item, select the last item.
DOWN/RIGHT - Select the next item. If on last item, select the first item.

option.name: dropdown
option.desc: If set to true the menu will open as a pop-up. Otherwise the menu is opened below the button just like a native select element.

option.name: appendTo
option.desc: Which element the menu should be appended to. Override this when the selectmenu is inside a position: fixed element. Otherwise the popup menu would still scroll with the page.

option.name: position
option.desc: Identifies the position of the menu in relation to the associated button element. Please note position option my and at will be overwritten if option dropdown is set to true. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options.

event.name: focus
event.desc: Triggered when an items gains focus.

event.name: select
event.desc: Triggered when a menu item is selected.

event.name: close
event.desc: Triggered when the menu is hidden.

event.name: change
event.desc: Triggered when the selected item has changed. Not every select event will fire an change event.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Parses the original element again and rerenders the menu. New options or optgroups can be added, removed or disabled.

method.name: widget
method.desc: Returns a jQuery object containing the button element.

method.name: menuWidget
method.desc: Returns a jQuery object containing the menu element.

example.html: <label for="speed">Select a speed:</label> <select name="speed" id="speed"> <option value="Slower">Slower</option> <option value="Slow">Slow</option> <option value="Medium" selected="selected">Medium</option> <option value="Fast">Fast</option> <option value="Faster">Faster</option> </select>

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Selectmenu with optgroups
example.html: <label for="files">Select a file:</label> <select name="files" id="files"> <optgroup label="Scripts"> <option value="jquery">jQuery.js</option> <option value="jqueryui">ui.jQuery.js</option> </optgroup> <optgroup label="Other files"> <option value="somefile">Some unknown file</option> <option value="someotherfile">Some other file</option> </optgroup> </select>

example.desc: A jQuery UI Selectmenu with overflow in pop-up mode
example.html: <label for="number">Select a number:</label> <select name="number" id="number"> <option value="1">1</option> <option value="2" selected="selected">2</option> <option value="3">3</option> <option value="4">4</option> <option value="5">5</option> <option value="6">6</option> <option value="7">7</option> <option value="8">8</option> <option value="9">9</option> <option value="10">10</option> <option value="11">11</option> <option value="12">12</option> <option value="13">13</option> <option value="14">14</option> <option value="15">15</option> <option value="16">16</option> <option value="17">17</option> <option value="18">18</option> <option value="19">19</option> </select>
